unnormalised: Brig. Sharma (Retd.) recounts his experience during the '71 war. He recalls receiving orders from Col. Verma on 03/12/1971 to secure a strategic location. The mission was critical, and the lives of many jawans depended on it. Capt. Khan led a small contingent, facing heavy resistance.
normalised: Brigadier Sharma (Retired) recounts his experience during the seventy one war. He recalls receiving orders from Colonel Verma on third December nineteen seventy one to secure a strategic location. The mission was critical, and the lives of many jawans depended on it. Captain Khan led a small contingent, facing heavy resistance.

unnormalised: Subedar Major Patil displayed exceptional bravery, single-handedly taking down an enemy bunker. Lt. Nair, fresh out of the academy, showed remarkable composure under fire. The challenges were immense, but the spirit of the Indian soldiers never wavered. They followed every order from Maj. Gen. Rao with absolute dedication.

unnormalised: The war, as explained by the now General Joshi, was a turning point. It showcased the courage and resilience of the Indian armed forces. Chief Petty Officer Singh's contribution in maintaining naval communication was crucial. The sacrifices made were immense.

unnormalised: Rear Admiral Kumar (then a Lieutenant Commander) remembers the naval blockade. His leadership was vital in securing victory. Air Marshal Reddy (then a Group Captain) played a key role in air support. Every rank, from Sepoy to Field Marshal, contributed to the triumph.
